intro: Gastrolobium crispatum, commonly known as the serrated wattle, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and fern-like leaves, which are typically serrated along the edges. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family. It is well adapted to sandy soils and can thrive in arid environments. Gastrolobium crispatum is often found in coastal and inland regions, contributing to local biodiversity.
